Slack Workspace Setup

The Model: Weekly Battlefields

Students maintain a personal Notion page (their portfolio) and share findings to weekly Slack battlefield channels. No fixed groups â€” students drift between positions and topics based on interest.

Channel Structure

Core Channels

  • #announcements â€” Instructor posts only
  • #general â€” Open discussion, questions
  • #resources â€” Shared articles, videos, useful links

Weekly Battlefield Channels

Created fresh each week:

  • #w1-battlefield-ai â€” Week 1: Us vs. the AI
  • #w2-battlefield-food â€” Week 2: Food Systems
  • #w3-battlefield-energy â€” Week 3: Energy
  • #w4-battlefield-cities â€” Week 4: Cities & Architecture
  • â€¦ (continue for each week)

How It Works

Before Class (Homework)

  1. Research the weekâ€™s topic
  2. Add findings to your personal Notion page
  3. Post to Slack â€” share your best fact/story to the battlefield channel
  4. Tag your position: [PRO CLIMATE] or [PRO DEVELOPMENT]

During Class

First 50 minutes: Instructor presents facts, stakes, and angles of attack for both sides.

Second 50 minutes: 1. Students find others with similar positions 2. Groups synthesize their best arguments 3. Groups present to the class 4. Debate between sides

After Class

  • Best contributions get added to the Channel Canvas
  • Students can continue discussing in the channel
  • Browse other weeksâ€™ channels for ideas

Slack Post Format

When posting to a battlefield channel:

**[PRO CLIMATE]** or **[PRO DEVELOPMENT]**

ðŸ“Š **My Fact:**
[One key statistic or data point]
Source: [link]

ðŸ“– **My Story:**
[One real case in 2-3 sentences]
Source: [link]

ðŸ’¥ **My Spectacle:**
"[Your emotionally compelling version]"

ðŸ”— **Full research:** [Link to your Notion page]

Channel Canvas

Each battlefield channel has a Canvas that curates the best contributions:

# W1 AI Battlefield â€” Best Arguments

## ðŸŸ¢ PRO Climate Action
### Top Facts
- [Sarah] AI data centers use more electricity than Pakistan...

### Killer Spectacles
- "My grandmother is alive because AI caught her cancer early" â€” Lisa

Why This Structure?

Benefit How
No lock-in Students choose their position each week
Cross-pollination Everyone can browse all channels
Accountability Contributions are visible and attributed
Portfolio building Notion page grows all semester
Natural clustering Passionate people self-select
Living archive Canvas preserves the best arguments

Student Checklist

Each week:

Remember: Every story must be fact-checkable. Emotions need reality backing them.
